content:
"Pride and Prejudice", written by Jane Austen, is a classic novel of manners that explores the social and economic realities of the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century. The novel focuses on the Bennet family, particularly the second eldest daughter, Elizabeth, and her relationship with the wealthy and proud Mr. Darcy. Austen uses irony and wit to critique the social norms and expectations of her time, particularly those related to marriage and women's roles.
What is the primary literary device used by Jane Austen in "Pride and Prejudice"?
A. Metaphor
B. Simile
C. Allegory
D. Irony
